title: AbuBhakar
author: AbuBhakar
content: Note: All post that is irrelevant to the subject will be deleted. Don’t post here if you don’t play this particular slot provider.I'm always complaining about this slot provider for being very hard to give a win. I knew that this slot game pays a lot if you are very lucky but I never won any huge amount from this provider as normal slot player that play 500+ spin every game. Bonus round is very hard to hit and it usually give a penny payout even you hit it for tons of spin. The only reason why I'm still coming back playing on this provider even with bad experience on results is due to its very good game graphics.Anyone here having a good time on this slot provider? Just making sure someone here having a good time on this hellish slot.

comments.author: Yaunfitda
comments.body: The only game that I love to play from Hacksaw Gaming is Wanted Dead or a Wild.But just like the rest of the games, it's based on RTP so I will say that my experience is so-so. Sometimes i will have like less than 20 spins and I will get the bonus. And then days that are totally lost all my capital winning hitting the bonus or even getting a good pay/multiplier.And perhaps it might have been discussed here by a thread by @mu_enrico Slots 101: Basics, Strategies, and Discussion (with poll).

comments.author: panjul07
comments.body: Quote from: Yaunfitda on July 21, 2023, 02:41:14 PMAnd perhaps it might have been discussed here by a thread by @mu_enrico Slots 101: Basics, Strategies, and Discussion (with poll).Agreed, no need to create a new topic for it as we have a thread to discuss about slot games by 3rd party providers created by mu_enrico. @OP, if you follow the thread created by mu_enrico, you will find that there are some users here who play hacksaw games including me. If you have ever heard "roycilik", he plays hacksaw games a lot and he had several times max win in hacksaw games such as Xpander, Stack'em, and Itero IIRC. I invite you to join the discussion in the slot 101 thread, but I'll tell you first my own experience in Hacksaw. My bets result was around 6,000x in Hop n Pop but it was long time ago, and the other one I remember is 2500x in Joker Bombs.

comments.author: ryzaadit
comments.body: Yes, @panjul was correct come to 101 Slot Thread.In there you will learn from experience and overview of each slot or provider. HackSwa Gaming is one of the slot provider who can provided you a big multiplier, however the volatility is really extream and cannot be predictable comparing to the provider like "Pragmatic & PlayNGo" they can easily to be predicted (example: hitting scatter around 100-120 spin).But they have a shitty max win multiplier. Meanwhile a slot like HackSaw Gaming, Push Gaming, Relax Gaming, No Limit, and other have really a random pattern we cannot make a prediction but once you hit a lucky moment (your multiplier winning can get really high) comparing Pragmatic & PlayNGo.

comments.author: Blitzboy
comments.body: My experience with Hacksaw games hasn't been the smoothest ride either. Despite this, their games are akin to a hardcover mystery novel with a lousy ending, but a beautiful embossed cover. It's the graphics that make me keep spinning!Interestingly, I've recently had a somewhat pleasant experience with Hacksaw's "Mystery Motel". It took me about 600 spins to hit the bonus round, and even though the payout wasn't exactly jackpot-worthy, it was definitely better than the pennies you've experienced. The visuals were stunning and the storyline, enchanting. Might be worth a try if you haven't already!

comments.author: AbuBhakar
comments.body: Quote from: panjul07 on July 21, 2023, 02:49:49 PMQuote from: Yaunfitda on July 21, 2023, 02:41:14 PMAnd perhaps it might have been discussed here by a thread by @mu_enrico Slots 101: Basics, Strategies, and Discussion (with poll).Agreed, no need to create a new topic for it as we have a thread to discuss about slot games by 3rd party providers created by mu_enrico. @OP, if you follow the thread created by mu_enrico, you will find that there are some users here who play hacksaw games including me. If you have ever heard "roycilik", he plays hacksaw games a lot and he had several times max win in hacksaw games such as Xpander, Stack'em, and Itero IIRC. I invite you to join the discussion in the slot 101 thread, but I'll tell you first my own experience in Hacksaw. My bets result was around 6,000x in Hop n Pop but it was long time ago, and the other one I remember is 2500x in Joker Bombs. Thanks for the invite guys but my main goal here is to have a discussion specifically for this provider and not for general discussion that’s why I make this thread a self-moderated topic. I don't have any intention to make this discussion longer. I will visit that slot 101 thread in the future for more slot games discussion. For the meantime, Allow me to release my frustration on this provider and find reason to keep playing.

comments.author: Casdinyard
comments.body: Honestly thought that they were just ripping me off cause I never won anything in their games which doesn't really faze me that much cause I'm not gambling for profit but after a while you'd think that their games will be much more lenient on you, only to be disappointed cause they'll never let you win at all! I switched to a different slot provider after that cause Hacksaw's basically a hack for me lmao. Quote from: Blitzboy on July 21, 2023, 05:47:43 PMMy experience with Hacksaw games hasn't been the smoothest ride either. Despite this, their games are akin to a hardcover mystery novel with a lousy ending, but a beautiful embossed cover. It's the graphics that make me keep spinning!Interestingly, I've recently had a somewhat pleasant experience with Hacksaw's "Mystery Motel". It took me about 600 spins to hit the bonus round, and even though the payout wasn't exactly jackpot-worthy, it was definitely better than the pennies you've experienced. The visuals were stunning and the storyline, enchanting. Might be worth a try if you haven't already! Good for you then if you're able to win something lol cause as someone like me who never really pushes for a large bankroll especially if I'm not feeling like investing a lot in a game, Hacksaw's not going to be your best friend. Although I would agree with you, their visuals are definitely on a whole another level.

comments.author: Yaunfitda
comments.body: Quote from: AbuBhakar on July 21, 2023, 06:28:39 PMQuote from: panjul07 on July 21, 2023, 02:49:49 PMQuote from: Yaunfitda on July 21, 2023, 02:41:14 PMAnd perhaps it might have been discussed here by a thread by @mu_enrico Slots 101: Basics, Strategies, and Discussion (with poll).Agreed, no need to create a new topic for it as we have a thread to discuss about slot games by 3rd party providers created by mu_enrico. @OP, if you follow the thread created by mu_enrico, you will find that there are some users here who play hacksaw games including me. If you have ever heard "roycilik", he plays hacksaw games a lot and he had several times max win in hacksaw games such as Xpander, Stack'em, and Itero IIRC. I invite you to join the discussion in the slot 101 thread, but I'll tell you first my own experience in Hacksaw. My bets result was around 6,000x in Hop n Pop but it was long time ago, and the other one I remember is 2500x in Joker Bombs. Thanks for the invite guys but my main goal here is to have a discussion specifically for this provider and not for general discussion that’s why I make this thread a self-moderated topic. I don't have any intention to make this discussion longer. I will visit that slot 101 thread in the future for more slot games discussion. For the meantime, Allow me to release my frustration on this provider and find reason to keep playing.  Sure mate, we can understand your frustration and rants not just about Hacksaw, but recently we also have a member who just had a bad game against Evolution, When you feels like only draw is your win on Blackjack.So I guess everyone of us had bad days from game providers and it's good that we can get the frustrations out of our chest. But for those who have a good experience with Hacksaw then good for them I guess,  .

comments.author: maydna
comments.body: I don't know why my journey in playing slot games from this provider was so bad because I never managed to win it. Perhaps, I can still have fun playing slots from this slot provider, even though I'm still not lucky. I prefer Pragmatic Play, Red Tiger, or even Play'N Go over this provider because the difficulty of winning is lower than other providers.As for the game graphics, I think it's almost the same as other slot providers. But it seems like we need very high luck to win and even win a little money from slot games from this provider. Perhaps, I will try to play one or more of the slot games later.

comments.author: Beparanf
comments.body: Quote from: maydna on July 22, 2023, 10:14:06 AMAs for the game graphics, I think it's almost the same as other slot providers. But it seems like we need very high luck to win and even win a little money from slot games from this provider. Perhaps, I will try to play one or more of the slot games later.It’s really not the same in terms of graphics. Nolimit, Hacksaw and Relax Gaming are the top 3 slot provider that provides slot games with cool graphics and style that other slot provider failed to deliver. Playngo and Pragmatic are both same normal style slot games but they have the best hit ratio among slot providers based on my experience.I understand the frustration of OP with this provider but Hacksaw did pay me huge multiplier by playing Anubis. I believe it’s all about luck on who will get that massive payout.

comments.author: CarnagexD
comments.body: Quote from: Yaunfitda on July 21, 2023, 02:41:14 PMThe only game that I love to play from Hacksaw Gaming is Wanted Dead or a Wild.But just like the rest of the games, it's based on RTP so I will say that my experience is so-so. Sometimes i will have like less than 20 spins and I will get the bonus. And then days that are totally lost all my capital winning hitting the bonus or even getting a good pay/multiplier.And perhaps it might have been discussed here by a thread by @mu_enrico Slots 101: Basics, Strategies, and Discussion (with poll).Yes and it's crazy like the provider would make you win but just for a minimum amount but will not mitigate the losses. They will make you experience win but too little of chance. When there's a bonus spin it was actually like coded not to give you something haha. Idk maybe I'm just unlucky too  but my experience with H.Saw Gaming compare to other casino is just abit off for me.

comments.author: AbuBhakar
comments.body: I will now lock the thread and I suggest to move the discussion on this thread https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5249415.0 by mu_enrico. I'm already get over on this provider and decided to just ignore it to focus on slot games that gives me positive result.Reading other users that shares same experience makes me conlcude to avoid this slot provider since it's not working well on my gambling style.
